radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked tri-compartmental osteoarthrosis with prominent osteophyte formation and severe joint space narrowing. The medial joint space was the most narrowed compartment. There was subchondral sclerosis, especially in the medial hemi-joint space, and lateral subluxation and varus angulation. Significant subchondral cystic changes were noted involving the tibial plateau centrally and the medial femoral condyle, indicative of geode formation from osteoarthrosis.
